meanings.definition: An abnormal growth or lesion that may develop into cancer.
meanings.sent1: Regular check-ups can help detect precancer early.
meanings.sent2: The doctor found precancer during the routine screening.
meanings.sent3: The precancer was like a warning sign, telling the body to take action.
meanings.sent4: The precancerous cells were lurking, waiting to cause trouble.
meanings.sent5: Learning about precancer made me realize the importance of prevention.

meanings.definition: The stage before cancer where abnormal cells are present.
meanings.sent1: She was relieved when the biopsy showed precancer and not cancer.
meanings.sent2: The precancer stage is a critical time for intervention.
meanings.sent3: The precancer cells were like troublemakers causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The precancer was a storm brewing, waiting to unleash its power.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the precancer stage can lead to better outcomes.
